tag_list: orgsync, entrepreneur, founder, ceo, ruby-on-rails, cloud-computing
overview:
Eric co-founded OrgSync in 2007 with the goal of establishing OrgSync as the leading technology in campus communication. Eric has sharpened OrgSyncâ€™s strategic focus and concentrated on creating collaborative software to build an online campus. He has established core company values centered around premium customer service, developing tools using the most innovative technology, and creating applications that are easy to use and that meet the needs of all user group. Eric has also placed a strong focus on enhancing user growth and development as well as creating a secure platform for users to interact and communicate.

Prior to founding OrgSync, Eric had a career in investment banking at MHT Partners where he focused on high growth, middle market, web-based technology companies. Prior to MHT Partners, Eric spent time with Morgan Keegan as a financial analyst on the fixed income corporate trading desk. Prior to Morgan Keegan, Eric was a Lead Project Analyst at the Association of Certified Fraud Examiners. In addition, Eric spent several years leading student and community organizations, and has served as Project Manager for several corporate ventures, case competitions, and academic assignments.

Eric attended The University of Texas at Austin - Red McCombs School of Business. He graduated at the top of his class and received degrees in finance and accounting. Eric also earned his Eagle Scout Award and is a LeaderShape Institute graduate. Eric actively serves on the Texas Exes Scholarship Committee and enjoys cycling, running, and playing ice hockey.

degrees.subject: Finance, Accounting
degrees.institution: The University of Texas at Austin
